item.title: Sampling from a Multivariate Normal Distribution
item.description: In this post I want to describe how to sample from a multivariate normal distribution following section A.2 Gaussian Identities of the book Gaussian Processes for Machine Learning. This is a first step towards exploring and understanding Gaussian Processes methods in machine learning. Multivariate Normal Distribution Recall that a random vector \(X = (X_1, \cdots, X_d)\) has a multivariate normal (or Gaussian) distribution if every linear combination $$ \sum_{i=1}^{d} a_iX_i, \quad a_i\in\mathbb{R} $$ is normally distributed.
